snippet: The cause of their disunion no longer found a place within theirmemory; but a more unclouded past, childhood and girlhood, therecollections of an era teeming with thoughts and images of love andtenderness--of a time when they two nestled their soft cheeks upon thesame pillow, wove the same woof, shared the same rambles to Kellie-lawand Kilconquhar Loch, to Macduff's Cave and Balcarras Craig--cherishedthe same dear rose-tree, wept and laughed, grew pale or crimson, sad ormerry, as the same feelings swayed the hearts of both--came thronging toher mind; and as the past brought with it such gentle harmonisinginfluences, why should they not renew it in the future?
